SEARCH
Package lib.uilib.widgets.base

Class TextInput

java.lang.Object
lib.uilib.framework.Widget
lib.uilib.widgets.base.TextInput
All Implemented Interfaces:
InputWidget
public class TextInput extends Widget implements InputWidget
A TextInput widget that represents an input field for text data. This widget allows the user to enter text, validates it using a predicate, and displays a label associated with the input field.
Since:
2024-10-29

  • Field Details

    • field

      private final TextInputField field
      The text input field that this widget is bound to. It holds the label and value for the input field.

    • scanner

      private static Scanner scanner
      A scanner object to read user input from the console.

      Constructs a TextInput widget that binds to the specified TextInputField.
      Parameters:

  • Method Details

    • build

      public String build(BuildContext context)
      Builds the string representation of the text input field, including its label. The label is displayed in bold text style.
      Specified by:
      build in class Widget
      Parameters:
      context - The context used to build the widget's string representation.
      Returns:
      A string that represents the label of the input field, if the label is non-empty.

    • paint

      public void paint(BuildContext context)
      Paints the text input widget to the console by printing its label.
      Overrides:
      paint in class Widget
      Parameters:
      context - The context in which the widget is being painted.

    • read

      public void read(BuildContext context, Predicate<String> predicate)
      Reads the user input, validating it against the provided predicate. The user is prompted to enter a value, and the input is checked using the predicate. If the input is valid, it is set in the field. If the input is invalid, the user is prompted again. The global "Back" command ('0') allows the user to return to the previous view.
      Specified by:
      read in interface InputWidget
      Parameters:
      context - The context in which the widget is painted and input is read.
      predicate - A Predicate that validates the user input.

    • read

      public void read(BuildContext context, String failedMessage, Predicate<String> predicate)
      Reads the user input, validating it against the provided predicate. If the input is invalid, an error message is displayed. The user is prompted again until valid input is provided. The global "Back" command ('0') allows the user to return to the previous view.
      Parameters:
      context - The context in which the widget is painted and input is read.
      failedMessage - The message to display if the input is invalid.
      predicate - A Predicate that validates the user input.
